title: Hello from Legacy Esports - Ask us Anything!
body:
Hello everyone, 

Welcome to our AMA, please feel free to ask anything.

Here's our current roster and a snippet of their interests;

Top: Tally (Riven Cosplay, Redbull, Being a Snack pack enthusiast)
Jungle: Carbon (VB, Dragonball Z, The Gym Life) 
Mid: Claire  (Riot Benji, J-pop, Being Awesome at Mid)
Marksman: Lost (League of Legends)
Support: Cupcake (Arams, Tall Animals, Life as a professional Tennis player) 

Find us on 
Facebook at www.facebook.com/LegacyEsportsLoL
Twitter at www.twitter.com/LegacyOCE

Thanks for the support, we appreciate you all taking the time and effort to get to us a little better!
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

replies.body: For Lost: Do you feel more comfortable at LGC then TM? Do you think their team gameplay suits you better?

i was really close with the old TM roster personally, but gameplay wise we kinda sucked as a team unfortunately :^); so i guess it was more "comfortable" on TM, but as a whole legacy compliment the way i play better :D

For Carbon: Thoughts on Dragon Ball Super?
What's the key to a great Ivern?

For Tally:  Where is this Riven cosplay (for science)? If it hasn't happened then when is it happening?

For Claire: How does it feel to be back in OCE? What's the difference between playing in Japan vs playing in Australia?

It feels great to be back in OCE, I got a little homesick at times when I was in Japan because I didn't have many people to talk to. I love the people in the OCE scene. Playing in Australia is definitely a lot more intense because I only played in an amateur team while I was in Japan, it feels really good to grind hard. A huge thing I miss from Japan is the fact that I was able to play on the Korean servers.

I haven't watched dragon ball super.. I only really said DBZ cos I was being pressed for my favourite anime.. A great Ivern is somebody who has a good grasp of the oppositions pathing and knows how to abuse it!

Tally - What was your first impression on snackpacks?
Cupcake - Favourite professional tennis player!?!?!??!??!?!?!? (if you do watch...)
Claire - how come it says jpop
Lost - How did you balance school and League?

who gets all the grils in the team

thing is, i didn't balance school and league... LOL... i'd stay up until 4am doing homework and watching anime or some shit; then wake up for school on opl day already half dead xD. grades kind of suffered, but i still managed to get good scores despite the commitment to opl
Can confirm, I have no idea how this kid is even alive after attempting to balance both OPL and school the way he did.

Because Minky screwed up big time :(((

none of us get any girls
My favourite player to watch has to be Monfils, and my most respected is Federer

How confident are you guys about facing Chiefs when it comes to that, are you ready??

You've each played around the meta before, is seeing a Ziggs bot comp likely to be seen from you guys at all? (or any other unique comps)

Have any of you watched RWBY and if so, which was your favourite character?

Cheers! -Emyrald

P.S. Tally senpai notice meh!! :P (Idk i'm strange XD)
We're definitely confident for the Chiefs game, practice has been going well lately for us but we know how good of a team they can be

I'm confident that our series against Chiefs will be a good one, we're ready and I'm sure they are too!

Ziggs bot was a huge thing at the start of the season but is definitely out of meta now that Lethality ADCs are king.

I used to watch a bit of RWBY, most of the first season iirc

I would say i'm most confident vsing the Chiefs over any other team in the OPL. The reason being we have played each other for so long and they have maintained almost the same roster for such a long time that i'm just really used to their play style even though they are the hardest opponent we will face in oce

As for the meta i'm really happy with how the topside of the map is balanced, you can almost see any pick now and get away with it based on keystones and item changes so hopefully we can bring out some cool picks for everyone :)

I've watched every episode of RWBY I really do enjoy the show, as for a favourite episode I don't really have one I just really love the second intro
I meant favourite rwby character... whoops, I must've blanked out
ah I would probably say Qrow or Sun Wukong I seem to enjoy the characters who have the easy going attitude
For the whole team: Were any of you guys ever stuck in Bronze/Silver? If so, what did you do to get out and how long did it take?

I was never stuck in Bronze/Silver but when I started playing ranked I ended up in 1057 elo which was silver 4 ish? not really sure. I kinda just gave up on that season of ranked and played normal games all day with my mates, somehow I ended up Diamond 1 next season, I guess it was from playing league 12 hours a day that I slowly started improving. I still believe to this day that the only way to improve at league is through a long grind, you will never notice results overnight luckily we have the practice took now so it's extremely easy to improve at a champion. :)
I got placed in gold in season 2 but didn't play very often, so it took me a while to get out :P

I was stuck at 1200 elo (which was "bronze" back then.. there was no leagues system) for almost the entirety of season 1. I played warwick and udyr only and I really had no clue about the game, I started playing ranked as soon as I hit level 30. At the very end of the season I started to grasp it a bit more and that helped me climb out! By season 2 I was platinum (1900) in NA :)

Did you play any MOBAs before league? (if so which ones)  
And how long have you been gaming for?
nope, got into League as my first moba when I was 12, been playing nonstop ever since
I moved from dota on the original Warcraft 3 client to league at the end of season 1, and I've been gaming since the pokemon blue days ^_^

I played SotIS( Storm of the Imperial Sanctum) which was basically a DotA mod on the starcraft 2 engine. That was the first MOBA I'd ever played but a couple months after League got released I moved over to that because the friends I played SotIS with told me it was the same game but an actual game and not just a shitty mod lol (I say shitty but that game was actually hella fun).

Never played any MOBAs before league I was more into the RTS genre or grind focused games like Runescape and Warcraft 3. I didn't have good internet when I was growing up so I barely got to play online games, I would play an hour or two on the Playstation and go outside to play instead because even outside is more fun than laggy internet. I would say I've been gaming for 15 ish years but only seriously playing for the past 4-5

Hey guys. 
For Claire or Cupcake- 90% of it not happening, but is there a chance we could see Lux anywhere for any possible reason? 

For everyone (Including you,Minky) - What is the story behind each of your summoner names? And Tally, not only your summoner name, but your name changes? Were they just to change things up?

(also) For everyone- What are your favourite champions in terms of playstyle and design.

I wouldn't say it's too likely at the moment but we never know what could happen with the meta :) 

I was The Cupcake Man and always duo'ed with The Muffin Man, and he quit so I just kept my name :P for competitive only Cupcake could fit. 

My favourite champion is Bard easily, his kit is so fun and has so much potential for plays
For Claire: Are you prepared to get clapped by the one and only MidBeast? But seriously do you think MidBeast subbing for exile5 improves or hinders your chances of a win?

LET'S GO BOYS

haha nah but I think he's definitely a good player and will improve their chances of winning compared to when they used Glup

Greetings Legacy eSports! Big Fan :3

My question for each of you is, who is your favourite graphic designer in the OCE eSports scene? :P

~Elam
Yeah there's this guy called Elam not sure if you've heard of him but he's pretty good at doing Graphics, if you ever need work done you should hit him up
Come on elam that's not a fair question..
What are some interesting picks we could see from Legacy throughout the split? I really enjoyed the Talon game - looking forward to see what Tally can whip out in the top lane!
you'll have to wait and see :)
{{champion:41}} {{champion:41}} {{champion:41}}

I guess mainly for Tally and Carbon but Claire/Lost/Cupcake feel free to chime in too!

What are you going to do differently this split/this year to make sure that a repeat of last year's final doesn't happen? Whether it be vs. Chiefs or any other finals contender.

Well we have a different team for starters! Outside that we're not doing too much different, I think we have one of the best practice environments in OCE and a fantastic coach in [Soulstrikes](https://twitter.com/SoulStrikesOCE) so hopefully with a revitalised roster we can finally jump the last hurdle!
What are your individual thoughts on Praedyth? and do you think he can carry TM after the roster changes?
Praedyth is a pretty funny guy and I think he's a pretty solid player too. Can he solo carry on a new role? No idea, but it'll be fun to see the new TM roster in action!
I think he's very competent as a player and I know he can play a lot of roles as proven in solo queue. I hope for their sake though that they build some synergy and macro with their new roster ASAP
i love prae personally, and i think he'll be able to pull out some super good games to watch; but i don't think he'll be able to hard carry, because league is super team oriented right now

Whats the feeling (in a non BM way) to always placing second? Do you enjoy the normal week in, week out league enough to keep doing this?

Will not going international finally break your will to keep going?

How do you think other teams that never even get a sniff keep doing it?

Is coming second all the time worst than coming 3rd -> 8th?

I do enjoy the normal week to week League. It gets overshadowed a lot because we lost both finals but finishing first on the ladder both seasons last year meant a lot to me even though there was no direct reward for doing so. I've been lucky enough to get voted into the All-Star event the last two years as well so I still feel like I get a small taste of the international competition and that has sustained me so far haha. To be honest I think coming second all the time realistically isn't as bad as the other places. I'm sure there are a lot of teams who would like to be second and play on stage. But that being said, from my perspective, coming second really does feel like losing only because we've done it so many times. We can't seem to progress and so it does feel like we may as well have come last. How other teams do it? I don't know honestly haha, I'd never really though about what they think. I suppose they would just have to enjoy the week to week LoL the same way we do!

Claire ur a god, have my babies
Carbon, how often do you and egym talk about personal stuff nowdays?
Ah almost never really, mostly I just make fun of him.
this is bullshit
haha ily

Hey guys, 

When are you opening up the house to us outsiders again ? (I won't leak anything to AV I promise)

xd
no idea but it'd be nice to hang out with ppl here
For any: thoughts on the current TM lineup?
